title: 110_hr7165
content: The Act may be cited as the "Millennium Challenge Compact Improvement Act (MCIA)" and pertains to the Millennium Challenge Compact. The Millennium Challenge Act of 2003 is amended to limit the duration of Compacts to 5 years, with exceptions for projects that require more time, approved by the Board for up to 10 years. The Board can approve a Compact duration exceeding 5 years, with notification to congressional committees. Amendments allow for multiple Compacts with eligible countries. Eligible countries can have multiple Compacts concurrently or sequentially with the United States, subject to Board approval based on progress and objectives met. The amendments made by this Act apply to Compacts entered into between the United States and eligible countries under the Millennium Challenge Act of 2003, regardless of the date of entry. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to Section 613(b)(2)(A) of the Act. SEC. 3. AUTHORIZATION OF REGIONAL ASSISTANCE. (a) Assistance under the Millennium Challenge Act may be provided through a Compact with one country or multiple countries in the same region. (b) Eligible entities now include arrangements established by two or more eligible countries for a regional Compact. (c) Conforming amendments are made to the Act. Conforming amendments are made to the Millennium Challenge Act, including provisions for regional Compacts involving multiple countries. The Millennium Challenge Act is amended to include provisions for regional compacts involving multiple countries. The Chief Executive Officer may suspend or terminate assistance to countries in a regional compact based on certain criteria, and reinstate assistance as needed.
